intro: Ctenopsis pectinella var. delileana, commonly known as the Delile's ctenopus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow to orange. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
